alert.note: Alert for Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 28 at 9:59AM PDT until May 29 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: .A strong storm system will move across the area tonight and Sunday bringing moderate to heavy rainfall. This will cause rises on creeks and streams with some flooding possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Oregon and southeast Washington, including the following areas, in northeast Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon and Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In southeast Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. * WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain will develop this evening and continue through Sunday midday causing rises on area streams and creeks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
